lines.gurmukhi: gur isK sMiD imly diRsit drs ilv gurmuiK bHm igAwn iDAwn ilv lweI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Drisati Daras Liva , Gurmukhi Braham Giaan Dhiaan Liv Laaee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: When the devoted Guru-conscious person becomes one with the True form of the True Lord, his vision enjoins the holy sight of Guru. He who practices meditation on Lord's name remains attached with the words of wisdom of the True Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK sMiD imly sbd suriq ilv gurmuiK bHm igAwn iDAwn suiD pweI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Sabad Surati Liva , Gurmukhi Braham Giaan Dhiaan Sudhi Paaee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By the union of True Guru and his disciple (Gursikh) the disciple obeys the command of his Guru very sincerely and faithfully. By meditating on the Lord, he learns to reflect on the True Guru.

lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Svaamee Sayvak Hui , Gurmukhi Nihakaam Karanee Kamaaee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus union of a disciple with Guru imbibes the trait of service of the Master. He serves all without reward or desire as he has learnt that he is serving Him who resides in all.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK sMiD imly krnI su igAwn iDAwn gurmuiK pRym nym shj smweI hY ]50]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Karanee Su Giaan Dhiaana , Gurmukhi Praym Naym Sahaj Samaaee Hai ?50?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a person emerges as a person with ideal actions by virtue of the meditation and reflection on Lord. In the process, he attains equipoise and remains engrossed in it. (50)
